body.p:
Jamestown Ky. Feby. 9th 1862
To his excellency B. Magoffin Govr of Ky

Sir, Some months since, George W Collins a citizen of this County sent up his petition imploring your excellency to remit a fine of $50. assessed against him in the Clinton circuit court upon a charge of Carrying Concealed deadly weapons contrary to the law. He has not yet heard from that petition. And as we had full confidance in the merits of his case as made out by the petition we fear that the case has escaped your notice. In addition to the grounds & reasons relied upon in the petition we think that the great scarcity of money & particularly in our county ought to plead for him. In fact he cant raise the money now & for months past every person has violated that law and almost any other law that they desire to violate with impunity. And I could say without violence to truth that Mr. Collins was lawlessly & brutally arrested in my presence by a company of outlawd ruffians & carried to Camp Dick Robinson in the early days of that Camp & as he informs me lost enough in his absence on account of that outrage to have
paid the fine, but of course I do not offer that as any reason why he should be pardoned for many of us have suffered such outrages. I write for the purpose of calling your attention to the situation & to the further fact of his inability to pay it under the pressure of the times

I hope you may think the case meritious & I am satisfied all his neighbours desire that the fine should be pardoned. I suppose you will scarcely remember me & on that account I refer you to A. J. James, Nat Gaither Jr. and Nathan McClure who will deliver this letter & say perhaps something more to you about the case If I recollect right the petition shows that Mr. Collins had legal grounds for carrying the weapon & carried & drew it in self defense. But failed to attend the trial & make the defence under wrong advice, & the Judgment went by default he being at the time a citizen of Tennessee. I am now enabled to state that the petiton was sent up about the last of May or first of June & I hope it is accessible to you

His Excellency B. Magoffin
Govenor of Kentucky
Frankfor Ky.

Clinton
Russell Cir. Ct
$50. { Weapons
Geo. W. Collins
Remission
